Overseas Foreign Currency Borrowings by Authorised Dealer Banks

These shall include International  /  Multilateral  Financial Institutions  of  which  Government  of  India  is  a  shareholding member  or which  have  been  established  by  more  than  one  government  or  have shareholding by more than one government and other international organizations.

Subject: BEF statement - Submission under XBRL
Brief Description: It was decided  to  move  from  manual  reporting  of  above  mentioned statement  to  eXtensible  Business  Reporting  Language  (XBRL)  system from half year ended June 2015.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) for Civil Aviation Sector
Brief Description: The scheme permitting ECBs to be raised by airline companies for working capital as a permissible end use, under the approval route, subject to certain conditions to continue till March 31, 2016.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) for low cost affordable housing projects
Brief Description: The scheme of raising ECB for low cost affordable housing projects to continue for the financial year 2015-2016

Subject: Subscription to chit funds by Non-Resident Indian on non-repatriation basis
Brief Description: NRIs permitted to subscribe to chit funds, without limit, on non-repatriation basis subject to conditions stipulated therein.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (FourthAmendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Regulation 2, and 8 amended with respect to issue of employee stock options and sweat equity shares.

Subject: Rationalisation under Liberalised Remittance Scheme(LRS) for Current and Capital Account Transactions
Brief Description: Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS) for resident individuals- increase in the limit from USD 125,000 to USD 250,000 and rationalisation of current account transactions and remittance facilities for persons other than individuals.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Permissible Capital AccountTransactions) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Proviso to Regulation 4(a) amended to fix drawal limit at USD 250,000 per financial year.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) denominated in Indian Rupees (INR) - Mobilisation of INR
Brief Description: Recognised non-resident lenders permitted to enter into swap transactions with their overseas bank  which shall, in turn, enter  into  a back-to- back  swap  transaction  with  any  AD  Cat-I  bank in  India as  per the procedure stipulated therein.

Subject: Rupee Drawing Arrangement -Increase in trade related remittance limit
Brief Description: Limit of trade transactions increased from Rs.5 lakhs to Rs.15 lakhs per transaction. Further, Ad banks permitted to regularise payments exceeding the prescribed limit under Rupee Drawing Arrangements subject to additional requirements mentioned therein.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services - Declaration of Exports of Goods/Software
Brief Description: Requirement of declaring export of goods / software in form SFD in case of exports taking place through Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) ports dispensed with as the mandatory statutory requirements contained in the SDF have been subsumed in the Shipping Bill format.

Subject: Foreign Currency (Non-Resident) Account (Banks) (FCNR (B)) Scheme
Brief Description: Clarification that A2  form  is  to  be  filed  at  the  time  of purchase of foreign exchange using rupee funds and hence is not applicable while  remitting  FCNR  (B)  funds.

Subject: Merchanting Trade to Nepal and Bhutan
Brief Description:
Clarification that goods consigned  to  the  importers  of Nepal  and  Bhutan  from  third  countries  under  merchanting trade from India would qualify as traffic-in-
transit, if the goods are otherwise  compliant  with  the  provisions  of  the  India-Nepal Treaty  of  Transit and Indo-Bhutan Treaty of Transit respectively.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Export of Goods & Services)(Amendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Regulation 3(1) amended to remove references to form SDF

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) -Reporting under FDI Scheme on the e-Biz platform
Brief Description: Contains details of financial  aspects  for  using  the Virtual  Private  Network  (VPN) accounts obtained from National Informatics Centre (NIC) for accessing the e-Biz portal

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India -Review of FDI policy -Sector Specific conditions-Insurance sector
Brief Description: FDI in Insurance sector shall be permitted up to 49% subject to the revised conditions specified in the Press Note 3 (2015 Series) dated March 2, 2015.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services -Project Exports
Brief Description: limit of USD 20 million for Buyer’s credit which may be extended to foreign buyers in connection with export of goods on deferred payment terms and turn key projects from India withdrawn

Subject: Operational guidelines on International Financial Services Centre (IFSC)
Brief Description: Clarification that a  financial  institution  or  a  branch  of  a financial institution set up in the IFSC and permitted/recognised as such by the Government or a Regulatory Authority shall be treated as person resident outside India.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter-bank Dealings: Revised Position LimitsforForeign Portfolio Investors (FPIs)in the Exchange Traded Currency Derivatives (ETCD) market
Brief Description: The limit (long as well as short) for FPIs in USD-INR pair increased upto USD 15million per exchange. In addition,FPIs allowed to take long(bought)as well as short(sold)positions in EUR-INR, GBP-INR and JPY-INRpairs, all put together, upto USD 5million equivalent perexchange.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter-bank Dealings: Revised Guidelines relating to participation of Residents in the Exchange Traded Currency Derivatives (ETCD) market
Brief Description: Exchange Traded Currency Derivatives Markets - signed undertaking by CFO or senior personnel accepted for importers and exporters, eligible limits for hedging by importers increased to 100%

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) Norms / Anti Money Laundering (AML) Standards/ Combating of Financing of Terrorism (CFT) / Obligations under Prevention of Money-laundering Act (PMLA), 2002-Money changing activities
Brief Description: Foreign Exchange Department not to issue the instructions to the Authorised Persons (APs) on the captioned subject separately and the instructions issued by Department of Banking Regulation, Central Office, Reserve Bank of India in this regard so far and from time to time in future, mutatis mutandis, shall be applicable to all APs.

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) Norms / Anti Money Laundering (AML) Standards/ Combating of Financing of Terrorism (CFT) / Obligations under Prevention of Money-laundering Act (PMLA), 2002-Money Transfer Service Scheme (MTSS)
Brief Description: Foreign Exchange Department not to issue the instructions to the Authorised Persons (APs) who are Indian Agents under Money Transfer Service Scheme on the captioned subject and the instructions issued by Department of Banking Regulation, Central Office, Reserve Bank of India in this regard so far and from time to time in future, mutatis mutandis, shall be applicable to all APs.

Subject: Non-Resident Deposits -Stat 5 and Stat 8 Returns -Discontinuation
Brief Description: Stat 5 and Stat 8 Returns from March 2015 discontinued.

Subject: Acquisition/transfer of immovable property -Prohibition oncitizens of certain countries
Brief Description: Citizens of Macau and Hong Kong will also be included in the list of countries which are prohibited to acquire/transfer immovable property in India in terms of Regulation 7 of Foreign Exchange Management (Acquisition and transfer of immovable property in India) Regulations, 2000

Subject: External Commercial Borrowing (ECB) Policy - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: The all-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 2 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 99 dated March 30, 2012 to  continue to be applicable till March 31, 2015

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India -Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: The all-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 2 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 99 dated March 30, 2012 to  continue to be applicable till March 31, 2015

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Amended Schedule 1 with respect to Other conditions and Insurance companies thereby increasing the limit to 49%

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a PersonResident outside India) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Amended Schedule 5 with respect to chit funds being approved for NRIs

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Permissible Capital Account Transactions) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Amendment with respect to permissibility of chit funds

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (International Financial Services Centre) Regulations, 2015
Guidelines on Import of Gold by Nominated Banks / Agencies
Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings : Foreign Currency (FCY) - INR Swaps
Brief Description: In cases where the underlying is still surviving, the client, on cancellation of the swap contract, may be permitted to re-enter into a fresh FCY-INR swap to hedge the underlying but only after the expiry of the tenor of the original swap contract that had been cancelled.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 - Import of Goods into India
Brief Description: Requirement of submitting request in Form A-1 to the AD Category -I Banks for making payments towards imports into India dispensed with

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment -Reporting under FDI Scheme on the e-Biz platform
Brief Description: Advance Remittance Form (ARF) and FCGPR under the aegis of the e-Biz project to continue

Subject: Delay in Utilization of Advance Received for Exports
Brief Description: AD Category -I banks  advised to efficiently follow up with the concerned exporters in order to ensure that export performance (shipments in case of export of goods) are completed within the stipulated time period.

Subject: Foreign investment in India by Foreign Portfolio Investors
Brief Description: Contains queries received by RBI and clarifications thereto

Subject: Foreign investment in India by Foreign Portfolio Investors
Brief Description: FPIs permitted to invest in government securities,the coupons received ontheir existing investments in government securities. Theseinvestments shall be kept outside the applicable limit (currently USD 30 billion)for investments by FPIs in government securities.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Acquisition and Transfer ofImmovable Property in India) (Amendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Regulation 7 amended with respect to   Pakistan,  Bangladesh,  Sri  Lanka,  Afghanistan, China,  Iran,  Nepal,  Bhutan,  Macau  and  Hong  Kong

Subject: Foreign investment in India by Foreign Portfolio Investors
Brief Description: All future investments by an FPIwithin the limit for investment in corporate bonds shall be required to be made in corporate bonds with a minimum residual maturity of three years.Further, all future investments against the limits vacated when the current investment runs off either through sale or redemption, shall be required to be made in corporate bonds with a minimum residual maturity of three years.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment in Pharmaceuticals sector -Clarification
Brief Description: a special carve out for medical devices which was earlier given the same treatment as pharmaceutical sector to be made.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Simplification of Procedure
Brief Description: AD Category - I banks delegated powers to allow change/modifications in the drawdown and repayment schedules, reduction in the amount of ECB and increase in all-in-cost of ECB subject to conditions mentioned therein. Further, change in the name of the lender of ECB permitted subject to stipulated conditions and cases requiring transfer of the ECB from one country to another also permitted subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Export and Import of Indian Currency
Brief Description: Decided that an  individual  may  carry  to  Nepal  or  Bhutan, currency  notes  of Reserve  Bank  of  India  denominations  above  Rs.100/-,  i.e. currency  notes  of  Rs.500/-  and/or  Rs.1000/-  denominations,  subject  to  a  limit  of  Rs.25000/-.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Foreign Currency Accounts by a Person Resident in India) Regulations, 2000 - Remittance of salary
Brief Description: Clarified that facility available to an employee of a company under Regulation 7(8) of Notification No. FEMA 10 (as amended from time to time) shall also be available to an employee who is deputed to a group company in India. In addition, the term ‘company’ referred to  in  the  said  regulation  will  include  ‘Limited  Liability Partnership’  as  defined  in  the LLP Act, 2008.

Subject: Depository Receipts Scheme
Brief Description: Salient features of the Depository Receipts Scheme enlisted in the circular.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Review of FDI policy -Sector Specific conditions- Construction Development
Brief Description: Effective December 3, 2014 100% FDI under automatic route permitted in construction development sector subject to the conditions specified in the Press Note 10 (2014 Series) dated December 3, 2014.

Subject: Overseas Direct Investments by proprietorship concern / unregistered partnership firm in India - Review
Brief Description: Enlists the terms and conditions for considering the proposal of ODI by a proprietorship concern / unregistered partnership firm under the approval route. Some terms include track record of the concern/firm, KYC compliance, amount of proposed investment outside India does not exceed 10 per cent of the average of last three years’ export realisation or 200 per cent of the   net   owned   funds   of   the   proprietorship   concern   /   unregistered partnership firm in India, whichever is lower, etc.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings : Hedging under Past Performance Route -  Liberalisation of Documentation Requirements in the OTC market
Brief Description: Importers and exporters required to furnish quarterly declarations as per Appendix M signed by CFO/CS, aggregate outstanding contracts in excess of 50 per cent of the eligible limit may be permitted by AD Category I banks on being satisfied about the genuine requirements of their customersafter examination of stipulated documents. Further, mentions that the Statutory Auditor ought to also certify amounts booked with the AD Category I banks under hte facility and that all guidelines have been adhered to while utilising the facility over the past financial year.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a PersonResident outside India) (Amendment) Regulations, 2015
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 1 with respect to pharmaceuticals(limit raised to 100%) and Other Conditions

Subject: Non-resident guarantee for non-fund based facilities entered between two resident entities
Brief Description: Residents that are subsidiaries of multinational companies permitted to hedge their foreign currency exposure through permissible derivative contracts executed with an AD Category - I bank in India on the strength of guarantee of its non-resident group entity.

Subject: Security for External Commercial Borrowings
Brief Description: AD Category-I banks permitted to allow creation of charge on immovable assets, movable assets, financial securities and issue of corporate and / or personal guarantees in favour of overseas lender / security trustee, to secure the ECB to be raised / raised by the borrower, subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Overseas Direct Investments by Indian Party - Rationalization / Liberalization
Brief Description: Liberalisation of regulations regarding ODI by Indian party. Change includes: permitting creation of charge on shares of JV/WOS/ step down subsidiary (SDS) in favour of domestic / overseas lender, creation of charge on the domestic assets in favour of overseas lenders to the JV/WOS/ step down subsidiary, creation of charge on overseas assets in favour of domestic lender subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Deposit) Regulations, 2000 - Exemption thereof
Brief Description: Exemptions, laid down in Foreign Exchange Management (Deposit) Regulation, 2000, issued vide Notification No. FEMA 5/2000-RB dated May 3, 2000 (as amended from time to time), to include deposits held in accounts maintained with an authorised dealer by any multilateral organization of which India is a member nation, and its subsidiary/affiliate bodies in India, and its or their officials in India.

Subject: Rupee Drawing Arrangement - Delegation of work to Regional Offices-Submission of Statements / Returns
Brief Description: Clarification that subsequent to delegation of Rupee Drawing Arrangement (RDA) work, Authorised  Dealer  Category  I  banks  are  required  to  make  all  their  correspondence with  Reserve  Bank  including  submission  of  prescribed  statements  to  the  Regional Office  of  the  Foreign  Exchange  Department  of  the  Reserve  Bank,  under  whose jurisdiction  their  registered  offices  function.

Subject: Money Transfer Service Scheme- Delegation of work to Regional Offices-Submission of Statements / Returns
Brief Description: Clarification that that  subsequent  to  delegation  of  Money  Transfer  Service  Scheme  (MTSS) work,  all  Authorised  Persons,  who  are  Indian  agents  under  MTSS  are  required  to make all their correspondence with Reserve Bank including submission of prescribed statements  to  the  Regional  Office  of  the  Foreign  Exchange  Department  of  the Reserve Bank, under whose jurisdiction their registered offices function.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Export and Import of Currency) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 8 substituted to specify currency denominations permitted to be taken or sent out to Nepal or Bhutan.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Seventeenth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 2 and 13 and Schedule 1 amended with respect to depository receipts.

Subject: Overseas Investments by Alternative Investment Funds (AIF)
Brief Description: An Indian Alternative Investment Fund (AIF), registered with Securities and Exchange Board of India(SEBI), permitted to invest overseas in terms of the provisions issued under the A.P. (DIRSeries) Circulars No. 49 and 50 dated April 30, 2007 and May 04, 2007respectively.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Review of FDI policy - Sector Specificconditions- Railway Infrastructure
Brief Description: 100% FDI permitted in railway infrastructure sector under automatic route subject to conditions. List of activities of the Railway Transport sector provided. Further clarified that FDI beyond 49 of the equity of the investee company in sensitive areas from security point of view will be brought before the Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) for consideration on a case to case basis.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Review of FDI policy -Sector Specific conditions
Brief Description: Entries in Annex B to Schedule 1 to FEMA 20 modified with respect to Agriculture and Animal Husbandry, Defence,  Information Services, Trading, Financial Services, Banking - Private Sector, Commodity Exchanges, Credit Information Companies, Infrastructure companies in the securities market. Pharmaceuticals and Power Exchanges.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Sixteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amended Schedule 1 with respect to construction development: townships, housing and built up infrastructure (100% automatic route)

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Review of FDI policy -Sector Specific conditions- Defence
Brief Description: Effective from August 26, 2014, foreign investment i.e. FDI, FIIs, RFPIs, NRIs, FVCIs and QFIs permitted upto 49% under government route in defence sector subject to the conditions specified in the Press Note 7 (2014 Series) dated August 26, 2014. Portfolio investment (RFPI/FII/NRI/QFI) and FVCI investment not  to exceed 24% of the total equity of the investee company. Portfolio investment to be under automatic route

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Foreign Currency Accounts by a Person Resident in India) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: A citizen of a foreign State, resident in India, being an employee of aforeign company or a citizen of India, employed by a foreign company outside India and in either case on deputation to the office/branch/subsidiary/joint venture/ group companyin India of such foreign company may open, hold and maintain a foreign currency account with a bank outside India and receive the whole salary payable to him for the services rendered to the office/branch/subsidiary/joint venture/ group companyin India of such foreign company, by credit to such account, provided that incometax  chargeable under the Income-tax Act,1961 is paid on the entire salary as accrued in India

Subject: Remittance of Assets - Submission of Auditor’s certificate
Brief Description: Mentions that Reserve Bank has amended the Principal  Regulations through the    Foreign    Exchange    Management    (Remittance    of Assets) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014  notified  vide Notification  No.  FEMA 324/2014-RB  dated  October  31,  2014,  c.f.  G.S.R.  No.  803  (E)  dated  November  14,  2014,  with  respect  to submitting certificates on tax payments.

Subject: Import of Gold (under 20:80 Scheme) by Nominated Banks / Agencies / Entities
Brief Description: The 20:80 scheme and restrictions placed on import of gold withdrawn

Subject: Routing of funds raised abroad to India
Brief Description: Clarifies that Indian  companies  or  their  AD  Category  -  I  banks  are  not  allowed  to issue any direct or indirect guarantee or create any contingent liability or offer  any  security  in  any  form  for  such  borrowings  by  their  overseas holding  /  associate  /  subsidiary  /group companies  except  for  the purposes explicitly permitted in the relevant Regulations. Funds so obtained cannot be use din India unless they conform to the general specific permission granted under the relevant Regulations. Penal action for anyone who contravenes the provisions.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Deposit) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 4(5) amended with respect to deposits held in accounts maintained with an authorised dealer by any multilateral  organization  and  its  subsidiary/affiliate  bodies  and  officials  in India of such multilateral organisations, of which India is a member nation

Subject: Release of Foreign Exchange for Haj/Umrah pilgrimage
Brief Description: Authorised Dealers and Full Fledged Money Changers permitted to release the full amount of BTQ entitlement in cashor up to the cash limitspecified by the Haj Committee of India,to the Haj/Umrah pilgrims also.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Parking of ECB proceeds
Brief Description: AD Category -I banks permitted to allow eligible ECB borrowers to park ECB proceeds (both under the automatic and approval routes) in term deposits with AD Category- I banks in India for a maximum period of six months pending utilisation for permitted end uses subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Acquisition/Transfer of Immovable property - Payment of taxes
Brief Description: Clarified that transactions involving acquisition of immovable property under the  Foreign  Exchange Management  (Acquisition  and  Transfer  of  immovable  property  in  India)  Regulations, 2000 regulations shall be subject to the applicable tax laws in India.

Subject: Export of Goods / Software / Services - Period of Realisation and Repatriation of Export Proceeds - For exporters including Units in SEZs, Status Holder Exporters, EOUs, Units in EHTPs, STPs and BTPs
Brief Description: period of realization and repatriation of export proceeds fixed at nine months from the date of export for all exporters including Units in SEZs, Status Holder Exporters, EOUs, Units in EHTPs, STPs & BTPs until further notice.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of any Foreign Security) (Fifth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 2 and 26 amended with respect to Alternative Investment Funds.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of any Foreign Security) (Fourth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 19A amended with respect to ODI by proprietorship concern / unregistered partnership firm in India and Schedule II deleted.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Remittance of Assets) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 4 amended to include payment of applicable taxes

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident Outside India) (Fifteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Explanation to Regulation 2 clause viii b deleted

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 (FEMA)Foreign Exchange (Compounding Proceedings) Rules, 2000 (the Rules) -Compounding of Contraventions under FEMA, 1999
Brief Description: Further powers delegated to the Regional Offices of the RBI

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of any Foreign Security) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 18 amended with respect to pledge of shares of JV/WOS and SDS
url: Regulation 18A amended with respect to creation of charge on domestic and foreign assets

Subject: Memorandum of Instructions for Opening and Maintenance of Rupee / Foreign Currency Vostro Accounts of Non-resident Exchange Houses
Brief Description: Remittances to the Prime Minister’s National Relief Fund permitted through the Exchange Houses subject to the condition that the remittances are directly credited to the Fund by the banks and the banks maintain full details of the remitters.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Acquisition and Transfer ofImmovable Property in India) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 8 amended to account for applicable tax laws in India

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Issue of equity shares under theFDI Scheme against legitimate dues
Brief Description: Permits issue of equity shares against anyother funds payable by the investee company, remittance of which does notrequire prior permission of the Government of India or Reserve Bank of Indiaunder FEMA, 1999 or any rules/ regulations framed or directions  issued thereunder, subject to stipulated conditions

Subject: Data on Import of Gold Statement- Submission under XBRL
Brief Description: Decided to move from manual reporting of the above mentioned statements to eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL) system from half year ended September 2014

Subject: Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings: Hedging Facilities for ForeignPortfolio Investors (FPIs)
Brief Description: FPIs permitted to hedge the couponreceipts arising out of their investments in debt securities in India falling due during the following twelve months subject to the condition that the hedge contracts shallnot be eligible for rebooking on cancellation. The contracts can however be rolledover on maturity provided the relative coupon amount is yet to be received.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Thirteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment of Regulation 14 and Schedule 1 with respect to the Defence sectors.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Fourteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amended to Schedule 1 regarding prohibited sectors.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Manner of Receipt & Payment) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 3 and Regulation 5 amended with respect to payments for export of goods / software

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Export of Goods & Services)(Fourth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Regulation 3 and Regulation 16 amended with respect to declaration of export proceeds in respect of export of goods / software

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) in Indian Rupees
Brief Description: Recognised non-resident ECB lenders permitted to extend loans in INR subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Purchase and sale of securities other than shares or convertible debenturesof an Indian company by a person resident outside India
Brief Description: Stipulations regarding the manner of acquisition removed. Eligible investors permitted to acquire securities in any manner as per the prevalent/approved market practice.

Subject: Refinancing of ECB at lower all-in-cost - Simplification of procedure
Brief Description: Powers delegated to the Ad Category I banks to approve cases where Average Maturity Period(AMP) of fresh ECB exceeds the residual maturity of the existing ECB under the automatic route subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Liberalised Remittance Scheme for resident individuals-clarification
Brief Description: Requirement of post facto reporting stipulated in terms of  A.P.  (DIR  Series)  Circular  No.32  dated  September  04, 2013 withdrawn

Subject: External Commercial Borrowing (ECB) Policy - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 2 ofA.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 99 dated March 30, 2012 to continue to be applicable tillDecember 31, 2014

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified underparagraph 4 ofA.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.28 dated September 11, 2012 willcontinue to be applicable till December 31, 2014

Subject: Compilation of R-return: Reporting under FETERS-Discontinuation of ENC and Sch 3 to 6 file
Issue of Prepaid Forex Cards- Due Diligence and Adherence to KYC norms
Brief Description: Clarification that  prepaid  foreign  currency  cards  are  a form of foreign currency, similar to foreign currency notes or travellers cheques. As such,  the  authorised  dealers/FFMCs  selling  pre-paid  foreign  currency  cards  for travel  purposes  are  required  to  comply  with  the  same  rigorous standards  of  due diligence and KYC as they would in case they were selling foreign currency notes/travellers cheques to their customers.

Subject: Foreign investment in India by SEBI registered Long term investors inGovernment dated Securities
Brief Description: Investment limit in government securities available to FIIs/QFIs/FPIs enhanced by USD 5 billion by correspondingly reducing theamount available to long term investor from USD 10 billion to USD 5 billion within theoverall limit of USD 30 billion. The incremental investment limit of USD 5 billion shall be required to be invested in government bonds with a minimum residual maturity of threeyears. Further, all future investment against the limit vacated when the currentinvestment by an FII/QFI/FPI runs off either through sale or redemption shall also berequired to be made in government bonds with a minimum residual maturity of threeyears.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services - Project Exports
Brief Description:
AD banks / Exim Bank permitted  to consider awarding post-award approvals without any monetary limit and permitsubsequent changes in the terms of post award approval within the relevantFEMA guidelines / regulations. Further, stipulation  of  time  limit  of  30  days  for  the  exporter  undertaking  Project
Exports and Service contracts abroad to submit form DPX1/ PEX-1 /TCS-1 to the
Approving   Authority   (AA)   for   seeking   post   award   approval   not to  apply
Thenceforth

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) Norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Standards/ Combating of Financing of Terrorism (CFT)/ Obligation of Authorised Persons under Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002 - Money Changing Activities - Recognising E-Aadhaar as an ‘Officially Valid Document’ under PML Rules
Brief Description: e-KYC made a valid process for KYC verification under Prevention of money Laundering (Maintenance of Records) Rules, 2005 and e-aadhar downloaded from UIDAI website valid as an officially valid document subject to conditions stipulated therein.

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) Norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Standards/ Combating of Financing of Terrorism (CFT)/ Obligation of Authorised Persons under Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002-Money Transfer Service Scheme -RecognisingE-Aadhaar as an ‘OfficiallyValid Document’ under PML Rules
Brief Description: e-KYC made a valid process for KYC verification under Prevention of money Laundering (Maintenance of Records) Rules, 2005 and e-aadhar downloaded from UIDAI website valid as an officially valid document subject to conditions stipulated therein.

Subject: Money Transfer Service Scheme - Delegation of work to Regional Offices
Brief Description: Work related to authorization of Indian Agents delegated to the Regional Offices of the Reserve Bank.

Subject: Rupee Drawing Arrangement - Delegation of work to Regional Offices
Brief Description: Work of granting first time permissionto AD Cat-I Banks for entering into Rupee Drawing Arrangement (RDA) with non-resident exchange house delegated to to the Regional Offices of the Reserve Bank

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment - Reporting under FDI Scheme
Brief Description: Details regarding filing of FC-GPR and FCTRS and usage of NIC Codes as per the NIC 2008 version. Further, contains instructions for accessing a uniform State and District code list for reporting of details of FDI by Indian companies in Form FCGPR.

Subject: Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS) for resident individuals-Increase in the limit from USD 75,000 to USD 125,000
Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India -Issue/Transfer of Shares or Convertible Debentures- Revised pricing guidelines
Brief Description: Contains new pricing guidelines in  respect  of  transfer/issue  of  shares and  for  exit  from investment  in  equity shares with or without optionality clauses of listed/unlisted Indian companies

Subject: Issue of Partly Paid Shares and Warrants by Indian Company to Foreign Investors
Brief Description: Revised guidelines regarding eligible instruments and investors, pricing and receipt of balance consideration, reporting, compliance and other conditions

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a PersonResident outside India) (Twelfth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 1 - sub-paragraph (iv) added to paragraph 2 regarding issue of equity shares subject to sectoral caps, pricing guidelines, etc whcih are a part of the extant FDI guidelines

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 -Import of Rough, Cut and Polished Diamonds
Brief Description: Clean Credit i.e. credit given by a foreign supplier to its Indian customer/buyer, without any Letter of Credit (Suppliers’ Credit) / Letter of Undertaking(Buyers’ Credit) / Fixed Deposits from any Indian financial institution for importof Rough, Cut and Polished Diamonds, may be permitted for a period notexceeding 180 days from the date of shipment.

Subject: Financial Commitment (FC) by Indian Party under Overseas Direct Investments (ODI) - Restoration of Limit
Brief Description: Restored the limit  of  Overseas Direct Investments (ODI)/ Financial Commitment (FC) to be undertaken by an Indian Party under the automatic route to the limit prevailing, as per the extant FEMA provisions, prior  to  August  14,  2013. However, any  financial commitment  exceeding  USD 1 (one)  billion  (or  its  equivalent)  in a  financial year would  require  prior approval of  the  Reserve  Bank  even when  the  total  FC  of  the Indian Party is within the eligible limit under the automatic route (i.e., within 400% of the net worth as per the last audited balance sheet)

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of anyForeign Security) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulations 6, 9, 14, 15, 19 and Schedule V with respect to submission of APR, applications under Form ODI, acquisition of a company incorporated outside India and prior permission of the RBI for a proprietary concern in India to accept shares.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Tenth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 1

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a PersonResident outside India) (Eleventh Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 5 with respect to removal of the role of registered stock brokers.
