Subject: Remittances to non-residents - Deduction of Tax at Source
Brief Description: Reserve Bank of India will not issue any instructions under the FEMA with respect to tax issues.

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) standards/ Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT)/ Obligation of Authorised Persons under Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002 - Money Transfer Service Scheme - Change in period of maintenance and preservation of records
Brief Description: In view of the amendment to Section 12 of Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002 through Prevention of Money Laundering (Amendment) Act, 2012, Authorised Persons who are Indian Agents under MTSS required to maintain and preserve records for a period of at least five years.

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) standards/ Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT)/ Obligation of Authorised Persons under Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002 - Money Changing Activities - Change in period of maintenance and preservation of records
Brief Description: In view of the amendment to Section 12 of Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002 through Prevention of Money Laundering (Amendment) Act, 2012, Authorised Persons required to maintain and preserve records for a period of at least five years.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Permissible Capital Account Transactions)(Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Resident individual permitted to draw  from  an authorized person foreign exchange not exceeding USD 125000 per financial year or such amount as may be decided by Reserve Bank from time to time for a capital account transaction specified in Schedule I. Further, where the drawal of foreign exchange by a resident individual for any capital account transaction specified in Schedule I exceed USD 125000 per financial year, or as decided by Reserve Bank from time to time, as the case may be, the  limit  specified  in  the  regulations  relevant  to  the  transaction  shall  apply with respect to such drawal.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter-bank Dealings: Guidelines relating to participationof Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) in the Exchange Traded CurrencyDerivatives (ETCD) market
Brief Description: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) eligible to investin securities as laid down in Schedules 2, 5, 7 and 8 of the Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a person resident outside India)Regulations, 2000 (FEMA 20/2000-RB dated May 3, 2000 (GSR 406 (E) dated May 23, 2000)) as amended from time to time to enter into currency futures or exchange traded currency options contracts subject to the stipulated condition.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter-bank Dealings: Guidelines relating to participation of Residents in the Exchange Traded Currency Derivatives (ETCD) market
Brief Description: Contains conditions for domestic participants in the currency futures and exchange traded currency options.

Subject: Export and Import of Currency: Enhanced facilities for residents and non-residents
Brief Description: All residents and non-residents (except citizens of Pakistan and Bangladesh and also other travellers coming from and going to Pakistan and Bangladesh) allowed to take out Indian currency notes up to Rs. 25,000 while leaving thecountry.

Subject: Annual Return on Foreign Liabilities and Assets Reporting by Indian Companies -Revised format
Brief Description: Modified Foreign Liabilities and Assets(FLA) returns

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) standards/ Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT)/ Obligation of Authorised Persons under Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002 - Amendment to Section 13(2) - Cross Border Inward Remittance under Money Transfer Service Scheme
Brief Description: Authorised Persons, who are Indian Agents under MTSS, permitted to nominate a Director on their Boards as "designated Director" to ensure compliance with the obligations under the Prevention of Money Laundering (Amendment) Act, 2012.

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) standards/Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT)/ Obligation of Authorised Personsunder Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002 - Amendment toSection 13(2) - Money Changing Activities
Brief Description: Authorised Persons permitted to nominate a Director on their Boards as "designated Director" to ensure compliance with the obligations under the Prevention of Money Laundering (Amendment) Act, 2012.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Export of Goods & Services) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment with respect to 'project exports'.

Subject: Transfer of assets of Liaison Office (LO) / Branch Office (BO) / Project Office (PO) of a foreign entity either to its Wholly Owned Subsidiary (WOS) / Joint Venture (JV) / Others in India- Delegation of powers to AD Banks.
Brief Description: Powers relating to transfer of assets of LO/BO/PO delegated to AD Category-I banks subject to compliance with the stipulated conditions.

Subject: Basel III Framework on Liquidity Standards - Liquidity Coverage Ratio (LCR), Liquidity Risk Monitoring Tools and LCR Disclosure Standards
Brief Description: Contains the final guidelines on the LCR, Liquidity Risk Monitoring Tools and LCR Disclosure Standards. Clarifies that the LCR will be introduced  in a phased  manner starting with a  minimum requirement of 60%  from January 1, 2015 and reaching minimum 100% on January 1, 2019.

Subject: Pledge of shares for business purposes in favour of NBFCs
Brief Description: AD Category - I banks delegated the powers to allow pledge of equity shares of an Indian company held by non-resident investor/s in accordance with the FDI policy, in favour of the Non -Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs) - whether listed or not, to secure the credit facilities extended to the resident investee company for bona-fide business purposes / operations, subject to compliance with the stipulated conditions

Subject: Foreign investment in India -participationbyregistered FPIs, SEBI registered long term investors and NRIs in non-convertible/redeemable preference shares or debentures of Indian companies
Brief Description: Registered Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs), Qualified Foreign Investors (QFIs) deemed as registered Foreign Portfolio investors, registered Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs),long term investors registered with SEBI -Sovereign Wealth Funds (SWFs), Multilateral Agencies, Pension/ Insurance/ Endowment Funds, foreign Central Banks allowed to invest on repatriation basis, in non-convertible/redeemable preference shares or debenturesissued by an Indian company in terms of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 84 dated January 6, 2014and listed on recognized stock exchanges in India, within the overall limit of USD 51 billion earmarked for corporate debt.

Subject: Foreign investment in the Insurance Sector - Amendment to the Foreign Direct Investment Scheme
Brief Description: Effective from February 4, 2014, foreign investment by way of FDI, investment by FIIs/FPIs and NRIs up to 26% under automatic route permitted in insurance sector subject to the conditions specified in the Press Note 2 (2014 Series) dated February 4, 2014.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Export and Import of Currency) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 3 with respect to currency notes  permitted to be taken outside India.

Subject: Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS) for resident individuals-Increase in the limit from USD 75,000 to USD 125,000
Crystallization of Inoperative Foreign Currency Deposits
Brief Description: Authorised Dealer banks to crystallise, that is, convert the credit balances in any inoperative foreign currency denominated deposit into Indian Rupee, in the manner stipulated therein

Subject: Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings
Brief Description: Importers permitted to book forward contracts, under the past performance route, up to 50 per cent of the eligible limit. Further, importers who have already booked contracts up to previous limit of 25 per cent in the current financial year, shall be eligible for difference arising out of the enhanced limits.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (EighthAmendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 1 with respect to filing of Annual Return of Foreign Liabilities and Assets as specified by RBI from time to time.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident Outside India) (Seventh Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment of Regulation 9, Schedule 1, Schedule 2 and Schedule 2A

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident Outside India) (SixthAmendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 12 with respect to pledge the shares of a compan in favour of NBFC in India to secure the credit facilities

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (fifth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 5 with respect to listed non-convertible/redeemable preference shares or debentures issued in terms of Regulation 7(2) of the Regulations.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Foreign Exchange Derivative Contracts)(Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Addition of permission to a person resident outside India to enter into currency futures or exchange traded currency options.

Subject: Import of Gold by Nominated Banks / Agencies / Entities
Brief Description: Star Trading Houses / Premier Trading Houses (STH/PTH) which are registered as nominated agencies by the Director General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) permitted to import gold under 20:80 scheme subject to the stipulated conditions

Subject: Export of Goods-Long Term Export Advances
Brief Description: AD Category- I banks permitted to allow exporters having a minimum of three years’satisfactory track record to receive long term export advance up to a maximumtenor of 10 years to be utilized for execution of long term supply contracts for export of goods subject to the stipulated conditions

Subject: Overseas Direct Investments - Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) as Indian Party
Brief Description: Decided to notify a Limited Liability Partnership (LLP), registered under the Limited Liability Partnership Act, 2008 (6 of 2009), as an "Indian Party" under clause (k) of Regulation 2 of the Notification No. FEMA.120/RB-2004 dated July 07, 2004

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) from Foreign Equity Holder-Simplification of Procedure
Brief Description: Delegationof powers to AD banks to approve cases under the automatic route with respect to Proposals  for  raising ECB  by  companies  belonging to  manufacturing, infrastructure,  hotels,  hospitals  and  software  sectors from  indirect  equity holders and group companies,Proposals  for  raising ECB  for  companies  in  miscellaneous  services  from direct   /   indirect   equity   holders   and   group   companies,Proposals  for  raising ECB  by  companies  belonging  to  manufacturing, infrastructure,  hotels, hospitals and  software sectors  for  general  corporate purpose and Proposals involving change of lender when the ECB is from FEH-direct / indirect equity holders and group company.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Refinance / Repayment ofRupee loans raised from domestic banking system
Brief Description: decided that eligible Indiancompanies will not be permitted to raise ECB from overseas branches /subsidiaries of Indian banks for the purpose of refinance / repayment of the Rupeeloans raised from the domestic banking system in respect of Scheme of take-out financing, Repayment of existing Rupee loans for companies in infrastructure sector, Spectrum allocation and Repayment of Rupee loans.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy: Re-schedulement of ECB - Simplification of procedure
Brief Description: Delegation fo power to designated AD Category - I bank to allow reschedulement of ECB due to changes in draw-down shcedule and / or repayment schedule subject to the stipulated conditions.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Reporting mechanism for transfer of equity shares/ fully and mandatorily convertible preference shares/ fully and mandatorily convertible debentures
Brief Description: Decided to rationalise the procedure in cases with respect to reporting requirements (Form FC-TRS) for non-resident investors

Subject: Reporting of Cross Border Wire Transfers
Brief Description: Advised that   the  'Transaction  Based  Reporting  Format' (TRF)   already developed   by   FIU-IND and   being   used   for   reporting   Cash Transaction  Reports  (CTRs),  Suspicious Transaction  Reports  (STRs) and  Non-Profit  Organizations  Transaction  Reports(NTRs)  may  be  used for  reporting  the Cross  Border  Wire  Transfers.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment in Pharmaceuticals sector - clarification
Brief Description: Prohibits 'non-compete' clauses with respect to FDI for pharmaceutical sector, except in special circumstances with the approva of the FIPB.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in Limited Liability Partnership (LLP)
Brief Description: Decided that Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) formed and registered under the Limited Liability Partnership Act, 2008 shall be eligible to acceptForeign Direct Investment (FDI) subject to the stipulated conditions

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India- Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 4 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.28 dated September 11, 2012 to continue to be applicable till June 30, 2014

Subject: External Commercial Borrowing (ECB) Policy - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost  ceiling  as  specified  under paragraph  2  of A.P.  (DIR  Series)  Circular  No.  99  dated  March  30,  2012 tol continue to be applicable till June 30, 2014.

Subject: Rupee Drawing Arrangement - 'Direct to Account' Facility
Brief Description: Foreign inward remittances received under Rupee Drawing Arrangement (RDA) permitted  to be transferred to the KYC compliant beneficiary bank accounts through electronic mode, such as, NEFT, IMPS, etc.

Subject: Risk Management & Inter-Bank Dealings:Booking of Forward Contracts -Liberalisation
Brief Description: All resident individuals, firms and companies, who have actual or anticipated foreign exchange exposures permitted to book foreign exchange forward contracts up to US$250,000 on the basis of a simple declaration without any requirement of further documentation.

Subject: Foreign investment in India in Government Securities
Brief Description: Foreign investment by all eligible investors including RFPIs permitted only in Government dated securities having residual maturity of one year and above and existing investments in T-bills and Government dated securities of less than one year residual maturity allowed to taper off on maturity/ sale.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 (FEMA)Foreign Exchange (Compounding Proceedings) Rules, 2000 (the Rules) - Compounding of Contraventions under FEMA, 1999
Brief Description: Powers to compound certain contraventions under FEMA, 1999 vested with the Regional Offices of the RBI.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Fourth Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 1 with respect to Insurance Companies, Brokers, Third Party Administrators and Surveyors and Loss Assessors.

Subject: Advance Remittance for Import of Rough Diamonds
Brief Description: Decided that henceforth Reserve Bank of India will not notify the names of overseas mining companies from whom an importer (other than PSC or Department / Undertaking of Government of India / State Government) may import rough diamonds into India, by way of advance payments, without any limit / bank guarantee/ stand-by letter of Credit.

Subject: Merchanting Trade Transactions - Revised guidelines
Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings
Brief Description: Contracts booked up to 75 percent of the eligible limit mentioned at paragraph 2(a) and 2(b) above may be cancelled with the exporter/importer bearing/being entitled to the loss or gain as the case may be. Contracts booked in excess of 75 percent of the eligible limit mentioned at paragraph 2(a) and 2(b) above shall be on a deliverable basis and cannot be cancelled, implying that in the event of cancellation, the exporter/importer shall have to bear the loss but will not be entitled to receive the gain.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) for Civil Aviation Sector
Brief Description: The scheme of raising ECB for working capital for Civil Aviation Sector under  A.P. (DIR  Series)  Circular  No.  113  dated  April  24,  2012 to continue till March 31, 2015

Subject: Foreign Portfolio Investor - investment under Portfolio Investment Scheme, Government and Corporate debt
Brief Description: Puts in place a framework for investments under a new scheme called 'Foreign Portfolio Investment' Scheme. Contains salient features of the scheme.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Crystallization of Inoperative Foreign Currency Deposits) Regulations, 2014
Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 2 and Regulation 5 with respect to contribution of foreign capital in the capital structure of a Limited Liability Partnership.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a PersonResident Outside India) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulations 2, 5, 14, Schedule I, Schedule 5 and Schedule 7 with respect to Registered Foreign Portfolio Investors (RFPIs).

Subject: Rupee Drawing Arrangement - Increase in trade related remittance limit
Brief Description: The limit of trade transactions increased from the existing Rs 2,00,000/- (Rupees Two Lakh only) per transaction to Rs 5,00,000/- (Rupees Five Lakh only) per transaction

Subject: Money Transfer Service Scheme - 'Direct to Account' facility
Brief Description: Permits foreign  inward  remittances  received under  MTSS  to  be transferred to the KYC compliant beneficiary bank account through electronic mode, such as NEFT, IMPS, etc.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a PersonResident outside India) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Schedule 1 amended with respect to the pharmaceuticals sector permitting 100% investment with the specific condition that non-compete clauses would not be permitted except in special circumstances with the approval of the FIPB

Subject: Export of Goods and Services: Export Data Processing and Monitoring System (EDPMS)
Brief Description: Entire shipping documents directed to be reported in the new EDPMS sysrem and old documents to continue to be reported in the old system till completion of the cycle until the old system is discontinued.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Establishment in India of Branch or Officeor Other Place of Business) (Amendment) Regulations, 2014
Brief Description: Addition of Regulation 8 to the Principal Regulations stating that a person resident outside India permitted to establish a Branch or Project or Liaison Office may, at the time of closure of such Branch/Project or Liaison Office must apply to the authorised dealer concerned for transfer of its assets to JV/WOS or any other entity in India.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) into a Small Scale Industrial Undertakings (SSI) / Micro & Small Enterprises (MSE) and in Industrial Undertaking manufacturing items reserved for SSI/MSE
Brief Description: Guidelines for FDI in Small Scale Industrial Undertakings / Micro and Small Enterprises reviewed in view of the Micro,   Small   and   Medium Enterprises Development  (MSMED)  Act,  2006.

Subject: Facilities to NRIs/PIOs and Foreign Nationals - Liberalisation - Reporting Requirement
Brief Description: The frequency of reports with respect to the total number of applicants and total amount remitted reduced to monthly as against quarterly.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) - Reporting arrangements
Brief Description: Format of ECB-2 [Reporting of actual transactions of External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) under Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 (for all categories and any amount of loan)] modified.

Subject: Foreign investment in India by SEBI registered FII, QFI and long terminvestors in Corporate Debt
Brief Description: Existing Commercial Paper sub-limit of USD 3.5 billion reduced by USD 1.5 billion to USD 2 billion. The balance USD 1.5 billion shall,however, continue to be part of the total Corporate debt limit of USD 51 billion andwill be available to eligible foreign investors for investment in Corporate debt.

Subject: Import of Gold / Gold Dore by Nominated Banks /Agencies/Entities -Clarifications
Brief Description: Clarifications with respect to Advance Authorisation (AA) / Duty Free Import Authorisation (DFIA).

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment - Reporting under FDI Scheme: Amendments in form FC-GPR
Brief Description: Revised Form FC-GPR.

Subject: Corrigendum to Notification No. FEMA. 277/2013 - RB dated 8th May 2013
Brief Description: Minor clarification in Regulation 15

Subject: Third party payments for export / import transactions
Brief Description: The requirement for "firm irrevocable order backed by a tripartite agreement" relaxed where documentary evidence for circumstances leading to third party payments / name of the third party being mentioned in the irrevocable order has been produced.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services: Export Data Processing and Monitoring System (EDPMS)
Brief Description: Regarding development of a comprehensive IT based system called EDPMS to facilitate banks to report returns through a single platform.

Subject: Foreign investment in India by SEBI registered Long term investors in Government dated Securities
Brief Description: Sub-limit of USD 5 billion  available to long term investors registered with SEBI - Sovereign Wealth Funds (SWFs), Multilateral Agencies, Pension/ Insurance/ Endowment Funds and Foreign Central Banks for investment in Government dated securities enhanced to USD 10 billion, within the total limit of USD 30 billion available for foreign investments in Government securities.

Subject: Facilities for Persons Resident outside India - Clarification
Brief Description: Clarification that a  foreign  investor  is  free  to  remit  funds through  any bank  of  its  choice  for  any  transaction  permitted  under  FEMA,  1999 or the  Regulations  /  Directions  framed  thereunder.  The  funds  thus  remitted  can  be transferred  to  the  designated  AD  Category-I  custodian bank  through  the  banking channel.

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) standards/ Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT) Obligation of AuthorisedPersons under Prevention of Money Laundering Act, (PMLA), 2002, asamended by Prevention of Money Laundering (Amendment) Act, 2009Money changing activities
Brief Description: Requirement of submission of Resolution of the Board of Directors for undertaking foreign exchange transactions with an Authorised Money Changer(AMC)  done away with.

Subject: Merchanting Trade Transactions
Brief Description: Revised guidelines for Merchanting Trade Transactions

Subject: Conversion of External Commercial Borrowing and Lumpsum Fee/Royalty into Equity
Brief Description: Clarification that the where the  liability  sought  to  be converted  by  the company  is denominated  in  foreign  currency  as  in  case  of ECB, import  of  capital  goods,  etc., it will  be  in  order  to  apply the  exchange rate  prevailing  on  the  date  of  the  agreement between  the  parties  concerned  for  such  conversion.

Subject: Clarification- Establishment of Liaison Office/ Branch Office/ Project Office in India by Foreign Entities- General Permission
Brief Description: Extending the requirement of special permission  for establishing a branch office or a liaison office or a project office or any other place of business by whatever name called, in India, to Hong Kong and Macau apart from Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Afghanistan, Iran and China.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings
Brief Description: In case of contracted exposures, forward contracts in respect of all current account transactions as well as capital account transactions with a residual maturity of one year or less permitted to be freely cancelled and rebooked. As far as the exposure of the FIIs/QFIs/other portfolio investors is concerned, forward contracts booked by these investors, once cancelled, permitted to be rebooked up to the extent of 10 per cent of the value of the contracts cancelled. The forward contracts booked by these investors may, however, be rolled over on or before maturity.

Subject: Provisions under section 6 (4) of Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 -Clarifications
Brief Description: Clarification regarding the nature of transactions covered under Section 6(4) of FEMA, 1999 [ section 6(4) :  A person resident in India may hold, own, transfer or invest in foreign currency, foreign security or any immovable property situated outside India if such currency, security or property was acquired, held or owned by such person when he was resident outside India or inherited from a person who was resident outside India.

Subject: Memorandum of Instructions for Opening and Maintenance of Rupee/ Foreign CurrencyVostro Accountsof Non-resident Exchange Houses
Brief Description: Revised list of Permitted Transactions under Rupee Drawing Arrangements(RDAs)

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment- Pricing Guidelines for FDI instruments with optionality clauses
Brief Description: Optionality clauses allowed in equity shares and compulsorily and mandatorily convertible preference shares/debentures to be issued to a person resident outside India under the Foreign Direct  Investment  (FDI) Scheme.  The  optionality  clause  will  oblige  the  buy-back  of   securities from  the  investor at  the  price  prevailing/value  determined  at  the  time of exercise  of  the  optionality  so  as  to  enable the  investor  to  exit without  any  assured return.

Subject: Resident Bank account maintained by residents in India - Joint holder - liberalization
Brief Description: AD banks permitted to include an NRI close relative (relatives as defined in Section 6 of the Companies Act, 1956) in existing / new resident bank accounts as joint holder with the resident account holder on "Either or Survivor" basis subject to the stipulated conditions.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Liberalisation of definition of Infrastructure Sector
Brief Description: For the purpose of ECB, 'Maintenance, Repairs and Overhaul' (MRO) will also be treated as a part of airport infrastructure. Accordingly, MRO, as distinct from the related services which are other than infrastructure, will be considered as part of the sub-sector of Airport in the Transport Sector of Infrastructure.

Subject: Issue of Non convertible/ redeemable bonus preference shares or debentures - Clarifications
Brief Description: An Indian company may issue non-convertible/redeemable preference shares or debentures to non-resident shareholders, including the depositories that act as trustees for the ADR/GDR holders, by way of distribution as bonus from its general reserves under a Scheme of Arrangement approved by a Court in India under the provisions of the Companies Act, as applicable, subject to no-objection from the Income Tax Authorities.

Subject: Overseas Direct Investments - Rollover of Guarantees
Brief Description: Decided  not  to  treat /  reckon  the  renewal  /  rollover  of  an existing / original guarantee, which is part of the total financial commitment of the Indian  party  in  terms  of  Regulation  6 of Notification No. FEMA.120/RB 2004 dated July 7, 2004 [Foreign Exchange   Management   (Transfer   or Issue   of   any   Foreign   Security) (Amendment)  Regulations,  2004]  as a fresh financial commitment subject to the provisions stipulated in the notification.

Subject: Import of Gold by Nominated Banks /Agencies/Entities
Brief Description: Clarifications regarding import of gold by nominated banks / agencies / entities.

Subject: Borrowing and Lending in Rupees -Investments by persons resident outside India in the tax free, secured, redeemable, non-convertible bonds
Brief Description: Resident entities who have borrowed in Rupees from  a  person  resident  outside  India permitted  to   issue   tax-free,   secured, redeemable,  non-convertible  bonds  in  Rupees to  persons  resident  outside  India  to use such borrowed funds for on lending / re-lending to the infrastructure sector; and for  keeping in  fixed  deposits  with  banks in  India pending  utilization by them for permissible end-uses.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) by Holding Companies / Core Investment Companies for the project use in Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs)
Brief Description: Holding Companies / Core Investment Companies (CICs) coming under the regulatory framework of the Reserve Bank permitted to raise ECB under the automatic route/approval route, as the case may be, for project use in Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs) subject to terms and conditions stipulated therein.

Subject: Overseas Foreign Currency Borrowings by Authorised Dealer Banks
Brief Description: if any bank is being sanctioned any loan from any international/multilateral financial institutions and is receiving a firm commitment in this regard on or before November 30, 2013, it will be allowed to enter into a forward-forward swap under the first leg of which the bank will sell forward the contracted amount of foreign currency corresponding to the loan amount for delivery up to December 31, 2013. However, if the bank is not in a position to deliver the contracted amount of foreign currency on the contracted date, it would have to pay the difference between concessional swap rate contracted and the market swap rate plus one hundred basis points.

Subject: Trade Credit for imports into India- Online submission of data on issuance of Guarantee/Letter of Undertaking (LoU) /Letter of Comfort (LoC) by ADs
Brief Description: Arrangement for reporting of data on issuance of guarantees/ LoUs/ LoCs by all AD banks decided in consolidated statement, at quarterly intervals, shifted from manual submission (and in MS-Excel file through email) to eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL) platform from quarter ended September 30, 2013.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Seventeenth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 5 and Regulation 9 with respect to shares or convertible debentures containing an optionality clause.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Establishment in India of Branch or Officeor Other Place ofBusiness) (Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Hong Kong and Macau added to the list of countries in Regulation 4 of the Foreign  Exchange  Management  (Establishment  in  India  of  Branch  or Office  or  Other  Place  of Business) Regulations 2000

Subject: Foreign investment in India - participation by SEBI registered FIIs, QFIs and SEBI registered long term investors in credit enhanced bonds
Brief Description: SEBI registered Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs), Qualified Foreign Investors (QFIs) and long term investors registered with SEBI - Sovereign Wealth Funds (SWFs), Multilateral Agencies, Pension/ Insurance/ Endowment Funds, foreign Central Banks permitted to invest in the credit enhanced bonds, as per paragraph 3 and 4 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 120 dated June 26, 2013, up to a limit of USD 5 billion within the overall limit of USD 51 billion earmarked for corporate debt.

Subject: Import of Gold by Nominated Banks /Agencies/Entities
Brief Description: Clarification that any  authorisation  such  as  Advance  Authorisation  (AA) /  Duty  Free  Import  Authorization  (DFIA)  is  to  be  utilised for  import  of  gold  meant  for  export purposes  only  and  no  diversion  for domestic use  shall  be  permitted.  For  any AA  /  DFIA  issued  prior  to  14th August 2013  the  condition  of  sequencing  the imports prior to exports shall not be insisted upon.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment in Financial Sector - Transfer of Shares
Brief Description: Requirement of NoC(s) will be waived from the perspective of Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 and no such NoC(s) need to be filed along with form FC-TRS. However, any 'fit and proper/ due diligence' requirement as regards the non-resident investor as stipulated by the respective financial sector regulator shall have to be complied with.

Subject: Third party payments for export / import transactions
Brief Description: Contains list of import and export transactions for which payment may be made by a third party.

Subject: Amendment to the "Issue of Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds and Ordinary shares (Through Depository Receipt Mechanism) Scheme, 1993"
Brief Description: Unlisted companies incorporated in India permitted to raise capital abroad, without the requirement of prior or subsequent listing in India, initially for a period of two years, subject to the stipulated conditions.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India -definition of 'group company'
Brief Description: 'Group company' defined as two or more enterprises which, directly or indirectly, are in position to: (i) exercise 26%, or more of voting rights in other enterprise; or (ii)  appoint  more than 50%, of  members  of board  of directors in the  other enterprise.

Subject: Corrigendum to Notification No. FEMA. 287/2013-RB dated September 17, 2013
Brief Description: Corrigendum replacing section 6(3)(d) with section 6(3)(e) in Section 3(i) of Part II of the gazetted notification.

Subject: Memorandum of Procedure for channeling transactions through Asian Clearing Union (ACU)
Brief Description: Only export/import transactions permitted under the ACU mechanism.

Subject: Closing of Old Outstanding Bills: Export-Follow-up -XOS Statements
Brief Description: Old export bill may be closed by AD banks as a one time measure, provided that the case is not subject matter of any pending civil suit /criminal suit ; the exporter has not come to the adverse notice of the Directorate of Enforcement (DoE) / Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI)/Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) /any such other law enforcement agency; has no externalisation problems with the export receipient countries and the export bill falls under specified categories

Subject: Overseas Foreign Currency Borrowings by Authorised Dealer Banks
Brief Description: Permission granted to AD Category I banks to borrow from international / multilateral financial institutions for a limited period up to November 30, 2013.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Sixteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 2 with repect to the definition of 'group company'.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Fifteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 7 with respect to a Scheme of Arrangement approved by a Court.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Thirteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 5 with respect to addition of 'credit enhanced bonds'.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Fourteenth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Clause (a) in  Regulation 10A(b)(v) deleted.

Subject: Export Outstanding Statement (XOS) Online Bank wide Submission
Brief Description: From the half year ending December 2013, XOS submission to be made online and Bank-wide instead of the present system of branch-wise submission through the respective Regional Offices of Reserve Bank of India.

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 4 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.28 dated September 11, 2012 to continue to be applicable till March 31, 2014

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Refinancing / Rescheduling of ECB
Brief Description: Facility for refinancing an existing ECB can raise fresh ECB at a higher all-in-cost / reschedule an existing ECB at a higher all in-cost under the approval route subject to the condition that the enhanced all-in-cost does not exceed the all-in-cost ceiling prescribed as per extant guidelines discontinued.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy ó Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 2 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 99 dated March 30, 2012 to continue to be applicable till March 31, 2014

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - ECB proceeds for acquisition of shares under the Governmentís disinvestment programme of PSUs - Clarification
Brief Description: Clarified that ECB allowed for all subsequent stages of acquisition of shares in the disinvestment process under the Governmentís disinvestment programme of the PSU shares; in other words, facility of ECB available for multiple rounds of disinvestment of PSU shares under the Government disinvestment programme.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange) (Fifth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 4 with addition of the words '"or any other entity as permitted by Reserve Bank'.

Subject: Overseas Foreign Currency Borrowings by Authorised Dealer Banks - Enhancement of limit
Brief Description: Requirement of minimum maturity lowered from 3 years to 1 year for borrowingsbeyond 50 per cent of their unimpaired Tier

Subject: Trade Credits for Import into India
Brief Description: Companies in all sectors permitted to avail of trade credit not exceeding USD 20 million up to a maximum period of 5 years for import of capital goods as classified by Director General of Foreign Trade (DGFT). Also decided to  relax the ab-initio contract period of 15 (fifteen) months for all trade credits to 6 (six) months.

Subject: Opening of Trading Office / Non-Trading Office / Branch Office/ Representative Office abroad
Brief Description: The practice of forwarding the statement in Form ORA to the respective Regional Office of Reserve Bank by the Authorized Dealers discontinued.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services - Project Exports
Brief Description: Submission of forms DPX1, PEX-1, TCS-1 and DPX-3, to the Office of the Reserve Bank of India (Foreign Exchange Department) within whose jurisdiction the Head Office of the exporter is situated, by the Approving Authority (AA) such as AD Bank / Exim Bank/ Working Group dispensed with.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Liberalisation of definition of Infrastructure Sector
Brief Description: Definition of 'infrastructure sector' for the purpose of availing ECB expanded

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing and Lending in Rupees) (Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment of Regulation 6 with respect to use of borrowed funds.

Subject: Overseas forex trading through electronic / internet trading portals
Brief Description: Restriction on online activities which are in violation of FEMA

Subject: Memorandum of Instructions governing money changing activities - Location of Forex Counters in International Airports in India
Brief Description: Non-residents permitted to carry Indian currency upto a maximum of `.10,000/- beyond Immigration/Customs desk to the Duty Free Area/Security Hold Area (SHA) in the departure hall in international airports in India for meeting miscellaneous expenditures subject to the condition that non-residents will not be allowed to carry any Indian Rupee beyond SHA and that they should dispose of Indian currency before boarding the plane.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Review of FDI policy - definition for control and sector specific conditions
Brief Description: Definition of 'control' revised.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services Simplification and Revision of Declaration Form for Exports of Goods/Softwares
Brief Description: A common form called Export Declaration Form- (EDF) devised to declare all types of export of goods from Non-EDI ports and a common SOFTEX Form- devised to declare single as well as bulk software exports.

Subject: Foreign Investment in India - Guidelines for calculation of total foreign investment in Indian companies, transfer of ownership and control of Indian companies and downstream investment by Indian companies
Brief Description: Condition (d) of Para 6(ii) of Annex to A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 1 dated July 04, 2013 as regards downstream investments by an Indian company which is not owned and/or controlled by resident entity/ties.

Subject: Overseas Direct Investment - Amendment
Brief Description: Amendment to the effect that an issue of corporate guarantee on behalf of second generation or subsequent level step down operating subsidiaries to be considered under the Approval Route, provided the Indian Party indirectly holds 51% or more stake in the overseas subsidiary for which such guarantee is intended to be issued.

Subject: Overseas Foreign Currency Borrowings by Authorised Dealer Banks - Enhancement of limit
Brief Description: AD Category - I banks permitted to borrow funds from their Head Office, overseas branches and correspondents and overdrafts in nostro accounts up to a limit of 100 per cent of their unimpaired Tier I capital as at the close of the previous quarter or USD 10 million (or its equivalent), whichever is higher, as against the existing limit of 50% (excluding borrowings for financing of export credit in foreign currency and capital instruments).  Further, AD Category I banks, at their option, permitted to enter into a swap transaction with RBI in respect of the borrowings raised after the date of this circular.

Subject: Corrigendum to Notification No. FEMA.230/2012-RB dated 29th May 2012
Brief Description: Corrigendum with respect to Medium and Small Enterprises.

Subject: Corrigendum to Notification No. FEMA. 243/2012-RB dated 19th October 2012
Brief Description: Corrigendum with repect to Qualified Foreign Investor definition

Subject: Corrigendum to  Notification No. FEMA.237/2012-RB dated September 25, 2012
Brief Description: Corrigendum with respect to Regulation 3

Subject: Export and Import of Currency
Brief Description: Existing limit ennhanced to Rs. 10000 per person

Subject: Purchase of shares on the recognised stock exchanges in accordance with SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeover) Regulations
Brief Description: A non resident including a Non Resident Indian may acquire shares of a listed Indian company on the stock exchange through a registered broker under FDI scheme subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange) (Fourth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 4 (2)(i). Limit enhanced from 50% to 100%

Subject: Issue of Bank Guarantee on behalf of person resident outside India for FDI transactions
Brief Description: AD Category -I banks permitted to issue bank guarantee, without prior approval of the Reserve Bank, on behalf of a non-resident acquiring shares or convertible debentures of an Indian company through open offers/ delisting/exit offers subject to tipulated conditions.

Subject: Overseas Direct Investments - Rationalization/Clarifications
Brief Description: Clarification that all the financial commitments made on or before August 14, 2013, in compliance with the earlier limit of 400% of the networth of the Indian Party under the automatic route to continue to be allowed. The limit of 400% of the net worth of the Indian Party for the financial commitments funded by way of eligible External Commercial Borrowing (ECB) raised by the Indian Party as per the extant ECB guidelines issued by the Reserve Bank of India from time to time.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings
Brief Description: Exporter allowed to cancel and rebook forward contracts to the extent of 50% of the contracts booked in a financial year for hedging their contracted export exposures and importers allowed to cancel and rebook forward contracts to the extent of 25% of the contracts booked in a financial year for hedging their contracted import exposures.

Subject: Liberalized Remittance Scheme - Clarifications
Brief Description: Contains clarifications on the Liberalised Remittance Scheme

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) from the foreign equity holder
Brief Description: Eligible borrowers permitted to avail of ECB under the approval route from their foreign equity holder company with minimum average maturity of 7 years for general corporate purposes subject to the stipulated conditions.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Twelfth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 14 and Schedule 1 with respect to definition of 'control'.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Eleventh Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 14 with respect to downstream investments

Subject: Investments by Non-resident Indians (NRIs) under Portfolio Investment Scheme (PIS) Liberalisation of Policy
Brief Description: Lieralised Portfolio Investment Scheme.

Subject: Foreign Investments in Asset Reconstruction Companies (ARC)
Brief Description: Ceiling for FDI in ARCs has been increased from 49% to 74% subject to the condition that no sponsor may hold more than 50% of the shareholding in an ARC either by way of FDI or by routing through an FII. The limit of FII investment in SRs may be enhanced from 49% to 74% of the paid up value of each tranche of scheme of Security Receipts issued by the Asset Reconstruction Companies.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of any Foreign Security) (Fifth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 6 with respect to 100% permmitted financial commitment of Indian party in JV/WOS and drawal of foreign exchange.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Permissible Capital Account Transactions) (Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 4 with respect to drawal of foreign exchange not exceeding USD 75000 per financial year.

Subject: Import of Gold by Nominated Banks /Agencies/Entities
Brief Description: Contains clarifications regarding import of gold.

Subject: Liberalised Remittance Scheme for Resident Individuals- Reduction of limit from USD 200,000 to USD 75,000
Overseas Direct Investments
Brief Description: Overseas Direct Investment reduced to 100% from 400% of the net worth of the Indian party.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 (FEMA) Foreign Exchange (Compounding Proceedings) Rules, 2000 (the Rules) - Compounding of Contraventions under FEMA, 1999
Brief Description: Refund of compounding offences to be credited to the applicant's account through NEFT.

Subject: Corrigendum to  Notification No. FEMA. 30/2000-RB dated November 17, 2000
Brief Description: Notification deemd to have come into force from 10 October 2000.

Subject: Non-Resident Deposits - Comprehensive Single Return (NRD-CSR): Submission under XBRL
Brief Description: NRD-CSR reporting moved to XBRL.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter-bank Dealings
Brief Description: Clarification that if an FII wishes to enter into a hedge contract for the exposure relating to that part of the securities held by it against which it has issued any Participatory Notes (PN)/ODI, it must have a mandate from the PN/ODI holder for the purpose.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter-Bank Dealings - Reporting of Unhedged Foreign Currency Exposures of Corporates
Brief Description: AD Category - I banks should submit the above quarterly report as per the revised format online only from quarter ended September 2013 through the Extensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL) system which may be accessed at https://secweb.rbi.org.in/orfsxbrl/.

Subject: Import of Gold by Nominated Banks /Agencies/Entities
Brief Description: The import of gold in any form/purity including import of gold coins/dore into the country rationalised.

Subject: Export of Goods and Software - Realisation and Repatriation of export proceeds - Liberalisation
Brief Description: Clarification that  that as the realization and repatriation period stipulation in terms of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 52 dated November 20, 2012 was valid till March 31, 2013 only, the time period for realization and repatriation of export proceeds from April 01, 2013 onwards till September 30, 2013, to be reckoned as nine months from the date of export.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Schedule 1

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy Repayment of Rupee loans and/or fresh Rupee capital expenditure - USD 10 billion Scheme
Brief Description: The benefit of USD 10 billion scheme extended to Indian companies in the manufacturing, infrastructure and hotel sectors which have established Joint Venture (JV) / Wholly Owned Subsidiary (WOS) / have acquired assets overseas in compliance with extant regulations under FEMA, 1999 subject to the stipulated conditions.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified in A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 99 dated March 30, 2012 to continue to be applicable till September 30, 2013

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 4 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.28 dated September 11, 2012 to continue to be applicable till September 30, 2013

Subject: Overseas Investments - Shares of SWIFT
Brief Description: General permission granted to a bank in India, being licensed by the Reserve Bank under the provisions of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, to acquire the shares of SWIFT as per the by-laws of SWIFT, provided the bank has been permitted by the Reserve Bank for admission to the ëSWIFT Userís Group in Indiaí as member.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Refinancing / Rescheduling of ECB
Brief Description: Instructions contained in the A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 112 dated April 20, 2012 relating to ECB to continue to be applicable till September 30, 2013.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Deposit) (Second Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment to Regulation 5 with respect to opening a single non-interest bearing Rupee Account with the Authorised Dealers in India without the prior approval of Reserve Bank of India, for the limited purpose of purchase of shares on the recognized stock exchanges in accordance with Regulation 10D of Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident Outside India) Regulations, 2000 (Notification No.FEMA.20/2000-RB dated 3rd May 2000).

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident Outside India) (Tenth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Regulation 10 D added with respect to acquiring control under the SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeover) Regulations.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings
Brief Description: AD Category - I banks should not carry out any proprietary trading in the currency futures / exchange traded currency options markets.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Non-Banking Finance Company - Asset Finance Companies (NBFC - AFCs)
Brief Description: NBFCs, categorised as Asset Finance Companies (AFCs) by the Reserve Bank and complying with the norms prescribed in the Circular DNBS. PD. CC. No. 85/03.02.089/2006-07 dated December 6, 2006 of the Bank, as amended from time to time, permitted to avail of ECB subject to the stipulated conditions.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter-Bank Dealings- Liberalization of documentation requirements for the resident entities in the Indian Forex Market
Brief Description: AD banks, while offering hedging products under the contracted exposure route to their customers may obtain an annual certificate from the statutory auditors to the effect that the contracts outstanding with all AD category I banks at any time during the year did not exceed the value of the underlying exposures at that time.

Subject: Foreign Investment in India - Guidelines for calculation of total foreign investment in Indian companies, transfer of ownership and control of Indian companies and downstream investment by Indian companies
Brief Description: Guidelines in the Annexure to the circular

Subject: Master Circular on Miscellaneous Remittances from India - Facilities for Residents
Master Circular on Risk Management and Inter-Bank Dealings
Master Circular on Foreign Investment in India
Master Circular on Import of Goods and Services
Master Circular on Exports of Goods and Services
Master Circular on External Commercial Borrowings and Trade Credits
Master Circular on Direct Investment by Residents in Joint Venture (JV) /Wholly Owned Subsidiary (WOS) Abroad
Master Circular on Memorandum of Instructions governing money changing activities
Master Circular on Compounding of Contraventions under FEMA, 1999
Master Circular on Establishment of Liaison / Branch / Project Offices in India by Foreign Entities
Master Circular on Remittance Facilities for Non-Resident Indians / Persons of Indian Origin / Foreign Nationals
Master Circular on Acquisition and Transfer of Immovable Property in India by NRIs/PIOs/Foreign Nationals of Non-Indian Origin
Master Circular on Memorandum of Instructions for Opening and Maintenance of Rupee/ Foreign Currency Vostro Accounts of Non-resident Exchange Houses
Master Circular on Money Transfer Service Scheme
Master Circular on Non-Resident Ordinary Rupee (NRO) Account
Import of Gold by Nominated Banks /Agencies
Brief Description: Import of gold against suppliers/buyers credit, as also import of gold on unfixed price basis to necessarily observe the discipline stipulated relating to cash margins and Documents against Payment (DP) basis. In other words, AD Category I Banks required to ensure that credit in any form or name is not enabled for import of any form of gold.

Subject: Risk Management and Inter Bank Dealings
Brief Description: Clarified that in case an FII intends to hedge  the  exposure  of  one  of  its  sub-account  holders,  (cf  paragraph  4  of schedule 2 to Notification No. FEMA 20 /2000-RB dated 3rd May 2000) it will be required  to  produce  a  clear mandate from the sub-account holder in respect of the latter's intention to enter into the derivative  transaction.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Structured Obligations
Brief Description: Credit enhancement permitted to be provided by eligible non-resident entities to the domestic debt raised through issue of INR bonds/ debentures by all borrowers eligible to raise ECB under the automatic route. Also, minimum  average  maturity  of  the  underlying  debt  instruments reduced  from  7 years  to  3  years.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy - Import of Services, Technical know-how and License Fees
Brief Description: Import of services, technical know-how and payment of license fees included as part of import of capital goods by the companies for the use in the manufacturing and infrastructure sectors as permissible end uses of ECB under the automatic / approval route as the case may be subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services - Project Exports
Brief Description: Exporter undertaking Project Exports and Service contracts abroad to submit form DPX1, PEX-1 and TCS-1 to the Approving Authority (AA) i. e. AD Bank / Exim Bank / Working Group, within 30 days of entering into contract for grant of post-award approval.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) in Renminbi (RMB)
Brief Description: Renmibi (RMB) scheme discontinued from date of issue of circular.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) for Civil Aviation Sector
Brief Description: The scheme of availing of ECB for working capital for civil aviation sector to continue till December 31, 2013.

Subject: Buyback / prepayment of Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds (FCCBs)
Brief Description: Existing scheme of Buyback / Prepayment of FCCBs under the approval route which expired on March 31, 2013 to be continued till December 31, 2013 and to be discontinued thereafter.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy for 3G spectrum allocation
Brief Description: ECB window for financing 3G spectrum rupee loans, that are still outstanding in telecom operator's books of accounts, to be open upto March 31, 2014.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) for the low cost affordable housing projects
Brief Description: Existing guidelines modified with respect to minimum experience, paid up capital, agregate limit for ECB, etc, issue of fixation of spread for on-lending by National Housing bank (NHB) and application requirements for Housing Finance Companies.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment -Reporting of issue / transfer of Shares to/bya FVCI
Brief Description: Wherever a SEBI registered FVCI acquires shares of an Indian company under FDI Scheme in terms of Schedule 1 of Notification No. FEMA 20 / 2000-RB dated May 3, 2000,as amended from time to time, such investments have to be reported in form FC-GPR/FC-TRS only, as applicable. W here the investment is under Schedule 6 of the Notificationibid, no FC-GPR/FC-TRS reporting is required. Such transactions would be reported bythe custodianbank in the monthly reporting format as prescribed by RBI from time to time. Revised forms FC-GPRand FC-TRS annexed to the circular.

Subject: Foreign investment in India by SEBI registered Long term investors in Government dated Securities
Brief Description: The limit for foreign investment in Government dated securities increased from USD 5 billion to USD 30 billion with. The enhanced limit of USD 5 billion to be available only for investments in Government dated securities by long term investorsregistered with SEBI - Sovereign Wealth Funds (SWFs), Multilateral Agencies, Pension/ Insurance/ Endowment Funds, Foreign Central Banks.

Subject: Processing and Settlement of Export related receipts facilitated by Online Payment Gateways - Enhancement of the value of transaction
Brief Description: The value per transaction increased from USD 3000 to USD 10,000 for export related remittances received through OPGSPS.

Subject: Export of Goods and Services- Realization and Repatriation period for units in Special Economic Zones (SEZ)
Brief Description: Units located in SEZs mandated to realise and repatriate, full value of goods/software/services, to India within a period of 12 months from the date of export. Any extension of time beyond the above stipulated period may be granted by Reserve Bank of India, on case to case basis.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Ninth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Regulation 14 containing guidelines for calculation   of   total   foreign investment in Indian companies, transfer of ownership and control of Indian companies and downstream investment by Indian companies added and Schedule 1 amended accordingly.

Subject: Import of Gold by Nominated Banks /Agencies
Brief Description: All Letters of Credit (LC) to be opened by Nominated Banks / Agencies for import of gold under all categories to be only on 100% cash margin basis. Further, all imports of gold to necessarily be on Documents against Payment (DP) basis. These restrictions not applicable to to import  of  gold  to  meet  the  needs  of  exporters  of  gold  jewellery.

Subject: Liberalised Remittance Scheme for Resident Individuals - Reporting
Brief Description: Liberalised Remittance Scheme data to be collected in soft form only.

Subject: Export of Goods and Software - Realisation and Repatriation of export proceeds - Liberalisation
Brief Description: Period for realization and repatriation to India, of the amount representing the full   value of goods or software exported, reduced from 12 months to 9 months.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Issue of equity shares under the FDI scheme allowed under the Government route against pre-operative/pre-incorporation expenses
Brief Description: Paragraph 3(II)(c) of A.P.(DIR Series) Circular No. 74 dated June 30, 2011 amended. Amended paragraph: Payments should be made  by  the foreign investor to the company directly or through  the  bank  account  opened by the foreign investor as provided under FEMA Regulations.

Subject: Import of Gold by Nominated Banks/Agencies
Brief Description: Import of gold on consignment basis by banks, restricted only to meet the genuine needs of exporters of gold jewellery.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) (Fourth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment of Regulation 5 with respect to guarantee by an Indian Party promoting or setting up outside India, a Joint Venture (JV) or a Wholly Owned Subsidiary (WOS) to or on behalf of such JV or WOS in connection with its business.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Foreign CurrencyAccounts by a person resident in India) (Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment of Regualtion 7 with respect to Foreign Currency Accounts held by an Indian Party for the purpose of overseas direct investments subject to stipulated conditions.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of anyForeign Security) (Fourth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment of regulation 2, 6,  15, 16, 20, 22 and 24 and insertion of Regulations 16A and 18A.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Export of Goods & Services) (Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: The proviso in Regulation 9 with respect to export of goods or software by units in Special Economic Zones (SEZs) deleted.

Subject: Overseas Direct Investments -Clarification
Brief Description: Clarification that that any overseas entity having equity participation directly / indirectly shall not offer  such  products  without  the  specific approval  of  the  Reserve  Bank  of  India  given  that  currently  Indian Rupee is not fully convertible  and such  products could have  implications for the  exchange  rate management of  the  country.

Subject: Investment by Navratna Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs), OVL and OIL in unincorporated entities in oil sector abroad
Brief Description: Navratna PublicSector Undertakings (PSUs) and ONGC Videsh Ltd (OVL) and Oil India Ltd (OIL) permitted to invest in unincorporated entities in the oil sector as well as incorporated JV/WOS in th eoil sector, which are duly approved by the Government of India, without any limits under the automatic route.

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India- Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All - in - cost ceiling as specified underparagraph 4 ofA.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.28 dated September 11, 2012 to continue to be applicable till June 30, 2013.

Subject: Memorandum of Instructions governing money changing activities
Brief Description: Authorised Money Changers (AMCs) permitted to sell Indian rupees to foreign tourists /visitors against International Credit Cards / InternationalDebit Cards and directed to take prompt steps to obtain reimbursement through normal banking channels.

Subject: Foreign investment in India by SEBI registered FIIs in Government Securities and Corporate Debt
Brief Description: Existing debt limits merged into two categories: Government Debt Limit and Corporate Debt Limit.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident outside India) (Eighth Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment of Schedule 5 with respect to replacement of the term 'FII' with 'eligible investors' and regarding investment by QFIs and long term investors like Sovereign Wealth Funds, etc.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of anyForeign Security) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Regulation 6D with respect to 'General permission for acquiring equity of Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT)' added.

Subject: Foreign ExchangeManagement (Guarantees)(ThirdAmendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Proviso to Regulation 3A amended to broaden the application of the Regulation from just infrastructure companies to anybody who is eligible to raise foreign currency loan under sub-regulation  (1)  of  Regulation  6  of Foreign  Exchange  Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange) Regulations, 2000 read with Schedule I thereto.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange)(Second Amendment) Regulations, 2013
Brief Description: Amendment of Schedule II and Schedule III with respect to rescheduling of an existing Foreign Currency Borrowing and Trade Credit respectively.

Subject: Maintenance of Collateral by Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) for transactions in the cash and F & O segments
Brief Description: FIIs permitted to use, in addition to already permitted collaterals, their investments in corporate bonds as collateral in the cash segment and government securities and corporate bonds as collaterals in the F & O segment.

Subject: "Write-off" of unrealized export bills-Export of Goods and Services - Simplification of procedure
Brief Description: Subject to the stipulations regarding surrender  of  incentives prior to"write-off" adduced in the A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.  03  dated 22 July  2010, procedure for write-offs simplified by liberalising the limits of 'write-offs'.

Subject: Money Transfer Service Scheme -Revised Guidelines
Brief Description: Contains revised guidelines on Money Transfer Service Scheme.

Subject: Foreign ExchangeManagement (Guarantees)(ThirdAmendment) Regulations, 2013

(Dir  Series) Circular  No.58  dated 15th  December  2011.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) for Micro FinanceInstitutions (MFIs) and Non-Government Organizations (NGOs)-engaged in micro finance activities under Automatic Route

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy -Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified in A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 99 dated March 30, 2012 to continue to be applicable till March 31, 2013

Subject: Trade Credits for Import into India

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India-Review of all-in-cost ceiling

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange)(Fourth Amendment) Regulations, 2012
Brief Description: Paragraph 5 of Schedule II omitted.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2012
Brief Description: Regulation 3A regarding restriction on obtaining overseas guarantee inserted.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange) (Third Amendment) Regulations, 2012
Brief Description: Paragraph (3)(xiii) inserted in Schedule II with respect to foreign currency borrowings for low cost affordable housing projects.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of anyForeign Security) (FourthAmendment) Regulations, 2012

Amednment of Regulation 15 with respect to Annual Performance Report and Annual Return on Foreign Liabilities and Assets. Section E and Section F under Part I of the Form ODI as  notified  vide Notification  No.  FEMA.180/RB-2008  dated September   5,  2008 to be substituted, which substitution to be deemed to have come into effect from August 21, 2012.

Subject: Export of Goods and Software - Realisation andRepatriation of export proceeds - Liberalisation
Brief Description: The period of realizationand repatriation to India of the amount representing the full export value of goods orsoftware exported, fromsix months to twelve monthsfrom the date of export with effect from October 01, 2012 till March 31, 2013..

Subject: Know Your Customer (KYC) norms/Anti-Money Laundering (AML)standards / Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT) Obligation ofAuthorised Persons under Prevention of Money Laundering Act, (PMLA), 2002,as amended by Prevention of Money Laundering (Amendment) Act, 2009Money changing activities

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing or Lending in Foreign Exchange)(Second Amendment) Regulations, 2012
Brief Description: Paragraph (3) added to Schedule I with respect to foreign currency borrowings by successful bidders of 2G spectrum reauction.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Transfer or Issue of Security by a Person Resident Outside India) (Sixth Amendment) Regulations, 2012

Schedule 6 amended with respect to investment by FVCIs and Schedule 7 amended with respect to two way fungibility of IDRs.

Subject: External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) Policy -Review of all-in-cost ceiling

Subject: Trade Credits for Imports into India - Review of all-in-cost ceiling
Brief Description: All-in-cost ceiling as specified under paragraph 4 of A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 28 dated September 11, 2012 to continue to be applicable for trade credits for imports into India until further review.

Subject: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in India - Allotment of Shares to person resident outside India under Memorandum of Association (MoA) of an Indian company - Pricing guidelines
Brief Description: In cases, where non-residents (including NRIs) make investment in an Indian company in compliance with the provisions of the Companies Act, 1956, by way of subscription to Memorandum of Association, such investments may be made at face value subject to their eligibility to invest under the FDI scheme.

Subject: Foreign Exchange Management (Export of Goods and Services)(Amendment) Regulations, 2012
